articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas is sticking to its demand that Gaza truce talks focus on a deal already discussed with Israel and mediators rather than starting anew, an official said on Tuesday, after Israeli airstrikes killed at least 19 Palestinians in the enclave.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire: Hamas says again it wants implementation, not more talks

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian forces on Tuesday struck back at Ukrainian troops with missiles, drones and airstrikes in actions that one senior commander said had halted Ukraine's advance after the biggest attack on sovereign Russian territory since the war began.
articles.title: Russia strikes back at Ukrainian forces in Kursk region

articles.author: Ramadan Abed
articles.description: When girls complain to Gaza paediatrician Lobna al-Azaiza that they have no comb, she tells them to cut off their hair.
articles.title: Gaza's girls cut off their hair for lack of combs

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk is due to interview Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on the X social media network on Monday in an event that could inject more surprises into the turbulent U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Elon Musk to interview Trump on X social media network

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin told visiting Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas on Tuesday that Moscow was pained by the plight of his people and backed their aspiration to create a fully fledged state.
articles.title: Putin tells Abbas of 'great pain' at Palestinian plight

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The globally active criminal ransomware group Radar/Dispossessor, which targeted at least dozens of companies in sectors including healthcare and transport, has been taken down, authorities in the United States and Germany said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Dispossessor ransomware group shut down by US, European authorities

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Only a ceasefire deal in Gaza stemming from hoped-for talks this week would hold Iran back from direct retaliation against Israel for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh on its soil, three senior Iranian officials said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Only Gaza ceasefire can delay Iran's Israel response

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhary
articles.description: Hospital services were disrupted in several Indian cities on Tuesday, after the nationwide spread of a doctors' protest against the alleged rape and murder of a 31-year-old doctor in the eastern city of Kolkata, authorities and media said.
articles.title: More Indian hospitals hit by doctors' protest against alleged rape and murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least five Haitian children have been killed or injured a week so far in 2024, charity Save the Children said on Tuesday, urging the United Nations and security forces to do more to protect kids from crossfire and gang violence.
articles.title: Haiti's child death toll mounts as security mission lags

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Huseyin Hayatsever, Giulia Paravicini
articles.description: A second round of Turkish-mediated talks between Somalia and Ethiopia over a port deal Addis Ababa signed with the breakaway Somaliland region ended without a deal on Tuesday, but Turkey and ministers from both countries sounded upbeat on progress.
articles.title: Second round of Somalia-Ethiopia talks in Turkey ends with no deal but progress made
